summary.p: 83 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: H. S. 188; Text: Q 8:54-Q 10:93; 8 lines per page; Dimensions: 210 x 150 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 6: "18 H. S. 188 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 150mm boy ve 210mm eninde cönk şeklinde 83 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî ile 150mm uzunl.[uğunda] 8 satır. Tahminen II - III. asırdan istinsah edilmiştir. Bu parça Anfāl (8) suresinin 54. ayetinin sonundan başlar ve Yūnus (10) suresinin 93[.] ayetinin ortasında biter."

This can be translated as follows: "18 H. S. 188 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 83 junk shaped leaves of 150 mm height and 210 mm width. The text area, written in Kufic script [contains] 8 lines measuring 150 mm. Probably copied during the 2nd-3rd [(8th-9th)] centuries. The codex begins at the end of Q 8:54 (Sūra al-ʾAnfāl) and ends in the middle of Q 10:93 (Sūra Yūsuf)."
